summary_comment: Nakayama-sensei is known for his engaging personality and interesting personal stories, which enhance the class experience. However, his lectures can be quite lengthy and monotonous. The class is relatively easy, requiring minimal effort beyond completing assignments, with assessments consisting of a take-home midterm and a final project.

Ratings.comment: Nakayama-sensei is a really cool guy who has some really cool stories and experiences to share in class. But unfortunately his lectures are pretty boring and last a pretty long time. This class is quite easy and basically you just need to do the assignments and you will pass easily. Midterm was take home and final was a project.

summary_comment: Kiyosue-sensei is highly regarded for making level 3 Japanese engaging and focused on language learning rather than grades or exams. Students praise his personable and kind demeanor, noting his willingness to help and his ability to make the class both informative and enjoyable. While some mention he can be a strict grader, overall, he is seen as a valuable and entertaining instructor who effectively balances teaching with cultural insights.

Ratings.comment: Kiyosue-sensei is an amazing professor that makes level 3 Japanese more about learning the language than completing assignments or studying for exams. The class is much more chill than level 1. His classes are very informative, and give a good contrast in perspective compared to the other Japanese faculty.
Kiyosue-sensei is a great teacher who makes class fun. His only issues is that he doesn't really teach sometimes and just like talks a lot but still a great guy who I enjoyed learning from.

Excellent professor that is more than willing to help students when needed! You get the grade you put into this class, but the teacher is understanding that at the 4101 level, you are there for your own language abilities and not for a grade! Grading criteria is same as levels below it and there are a few opportunities for EC! Highly recommend!

Kiyosue-sensei is an incredible teacher. Once you get to a classroom environment with him, he's very personable and kindhearted. He works hard to get to know his students and is more than willing to help you as a student if you're in need. Definitely a privilege to have him as an instructor.

Really appreciate Kiyosue. He is Hilarious and kind in class. He understands students and gives students really excellent class. He will also show Japanese culture in class, not just repeat script. Really recommend.

I'm gonna discuss fourth semester Japanese. Once you get to this point, Kiyosue ends up being much more personable. He will ask a question and if you can respond he will understand and give you points. He may prompt you after your response to respond with the new material, but overall if you give any thoughtful answer he will give you the points.

He can be really cool and helpful. He's a hard grader but he just follows the syllabus guide really stringently. Likes to ask questions about who the people in the videos are and what their relationships are with each other. Overall an enjoyable person

SEI.Subject: JAPANSE
SEI.Class Name: Level Four Japanese I: Classroom Track

SEI.Subject: JAPANSE
SEI.Class Name: Level Four Japanese II: Classroom Track

SEI.Subject: JAPANSE
SEI.Class Name: Level Four Japanese II: Classroom Track

summary_comment: The professor is passionate about the subject matter but lacks technical proficiency, making some aspects of the course challenging. Grading is primarily based on three comprehensive exams, which can be demanding. Class lectures are heavy and occasionally boring, though the material is valuable, especially for those who engage with the readings and attend classes regularly.

Ratings.comment: I took his class in the spring of 2023 and I think it was his first time teaching. He is not very tech savvy, but is kind when you have questions and concerns. He really enjoyed teaching and was passionate for the material, but the material is more about history than culture. You are graded on three exams, so it might be hard to do well.

The class was lecture heavy, so it got a bit boring sometimes, but as long as you do the work, which was only like two papers for the whole semester, it's relatively easy. The reading can be a bit difficult to understand or confusing, but it's a literature in translation class, so it makes sense.

Only 3 graded exams cover each module for the whole semester. Lots of reading, but class is usually a very calm environment. Go to class! Start of the semester was super slow with a lot of lectures, but once movies became common in class it was a nice break in the middle of my day. I typed up notes in class due to prof's slow upload of lectures.

I believe he was teaching this course for the first time when I took it, but I could tell he loved the material. The grading has likely changed, but the only three grades were 25-question exams. The pop quizzes mentioned in the syllabus never came to be. The online lectures were nice, and they helped to identify highlights from the readings.

SEI.Subject: JAPANSE
SEI.Class Name: Level One Japanese I: Classroom Track

SEI.Subject: JAPANSE
SEI.Class Name: Japanese Literature:  Medieval and Edo Periods

summary_comment: Richard Torrence is a knowledgeable professor who selects excellent readings but struggles with organization and clarity. Students find his lectures sometimes boring and unstructured, with frequent changes to exam dates and vague grading criteria. Despite these issues, many appreciate his accessibility during the pandemic and his generous grading on quizzes and papers.

Ratings.comment: Good selection of readings. However, he was very disorganized. He would constantly change exam/quiz dates and times with little warning. Was nice to be able to participate in the live lectures on zoom though. A lot of professors had moved away from this and when I had covid his course was the most accessible. Fair warning class was musty.

lectures can be boring, but as long as you keep up with the reading you'll be fine (honestly if you don't have the time to read everything, knowing the plot would probably be enough) he grades quizzes & midterms pretty generously, as well as papers, tho he can leave some harsh comments for your opinion papers, but overall he's a good professor

DONT TAKE ANY CLASS BY Richard Torrence. The class is easy but he’s easily the worst Professor I’ve ever had. The lectures are boring, the class is extremely unorganized, and he rly doesn’t care about your time.

I learned so so much in this literature class, loved it. Torrance is old and can be a little behind the times/transphobic, but its not so much malicious as he's very old. The books and readings he picks are amazing and he feels like the foremost expert in the field his lectures are amazing, but yeah you're signing up for an old white dude with him

He's your standard stand up and lecture professor. It was quite boring most classes even though I enjoy the content. His Canvas on the other hand is horrible. His file naming structure only makes sense to him and the files in question are poorly organized. He does provide study/review sheets before tests though so you know what to google.

His grading criteria was so unclear. He gave zero instructions or criteria for what he wanted for our research paper except "10 pages, try to connect it to the course material". Most classes were spent watching (or skipping around through) movies, and his lectures weren't great and he got off track a lot, but his quizzes were pretty specific.

He's very nice, but his class was a mess. He rambles on about nothing a lot (pornography came up more than once..) and we had a few days where we just watched movies. His tests are VERY specific, like, "what was this character wearing" specific, and not always based on lectures. & He forgot to give us a quiz, and counted it as the one he dropped.

The worst professor I've had at OSU. He came in every day smelling very bad. He kept showing us dirty images not related to the material we would be graded on. (hardcore stuff.) He gave a quiz that almost the entire class failed because it was a history quiz given in a literature class. Also he was extremely unprofessional, avoid at all costs.

He knows so much about what he teaches, but he mostly reads off slides during lectures. Class itsefl is usually nothing too special. You can get away with reviewing his docs on Carmen before tests. He's a super easy going teacher. Just show up and hang out. He shows plenty of movies and films. His class is fun, easy, and interesting.

Choose an easier GE! Lectures are extremely boring, and I don't say that often. The final grade is determined by 3 exams and 2 quizzes He is very quiet so sit in the first couple rows or you won't hear him. If you don't pay attention in class you won't do well on exams and quizzes because the questions are not always based on the review sheet.

Not a bad teacher for being new to teaching this class. Is very invested in his work and makes it very clear what the meanings of the stories and films are. Will answer questions clearly and well after class and helps to get you interested in works for analysis. Takes time to go over necessary things and makes sure everyone is involved.
Good professor, but you still have to review what he said in class otherwise it's not easy to get A

So for this class we have to read 5 books and several short stories. We had 3 quizzes and 1 final, you can drop your lowest quiz. He gave us review sheet before quizzes and final. So as along as you actually read all the books and novels and study for the quizzes and final, you should be fine!

He is nicer to girls but it is a really easy class. We view lots of weird japanese movies and even if you didnt read any novels just look it up on wikipedia the day before taking the exam or quizzes and you'll be totally fine.

I only came to this class about 6 times the whole quarter, came for reviews and took the tests. Easy easy easy easy. From what little I saw of him, this teacher seemed pretty talkative with weird stories about his life. Sometimes boring.. but sometimes funny.

Japanese Culture class with Torrance-sensei was awesome! He uses the textbook minimally, and gives good notes. His lectures are good too because he incorporates a lot of video, websites, and other forms of media. He also just so funny! A very quiet man with a great sense of humor. Torrance-sensei is my new favorite teacher!
Quiet, but if you come to class and pay attention, he's pretty easy. One of the most awesome professors I've ever had. He's very interactive and funny when he doesn't mean to be.
He's pretty easy as long as you attend class and read. Nothing to worry about. He can talk a little quiet sometimes.

SEI.Subject: EALL
SEI.Class Name: Introducing East Asia through Martial Arts Cinema

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her engaging and passionate teaching style, making even challenging material accessible and interesting. Students appreciate her thorough knowledge of the subject and her efforts to create an enjoyable learning environment, though some find the subject matter itself less engaging. Her clear communication and supportive approach are evident in her willingness to help students and provide extra credit opportunities, although a few note that the class can be quite dull at times.

Ratings.comment: Really interesting courses, recommend for your guys to take!!
One of the best professors at the Ohio State. She knows her teaching material very well and cares about students' feelings. A really nice person.

Had her for Ancient Kyoto. She loves the material she teaches and it shows in her lectures. She does her best to make class interesting and enjoyable. She was the highlight to a very dull semester. I would happily recommend her to anyone.

She's a great teacher who covers some difficult material but in the end it's not very hard to get a good grade.  She's helpful and a pleasure to talk to , and her tests are pretty straightforward with plenty of opportunities for extra credit.  I'm definitely taking her again.

Professor Fukumori is endearing and pleasant, but this course was exceedingly boring. She tries so hard, but the subject matter is just not interesting (unless you love women's studies). Also, she needs to go to a speech class; the number of uhs, ums, and likes was distracting bordering on absurd. Easy A, but do not recommend.
The class puts me to sleep but the material is interesting enough and has easy assignments and quizzes.  YES.  AND she has powerpoints so you can follow along exactly.  Awesome.
Great teacher. Easy and fun class
Goes out of her way to help you.
Awesome
GREAT
Fast Shipping and product was just as described. A+++++ ebayer, will do business agian! errr.... i ment good teacher, nice lady
No Comments
As long as you do the reading, this class is a walk in the park.  The quizzes aren't hard, the writings are only 3 pages each, and only two papers per quarter.  There is also extra credit.  Easy A.
Very helpful.

This class was not challenging. I would be amazed if the class average was lower than a 3.5. If you come to class, you don't have to do any of the reading. Even though it is not challenging, you will learn about culture and literature the entire term. It is probably the most worthwhile class at OSU.
No Comments

She was definitly an amazing professor. she is very interested in her material which made the class more interesting. Yes, there is alot of reading, but she made notes for us everyday and told us exactly what was on the tests. they were extremely easy if you went to class.She was very helpful with papers, and an easy grader. take her if you can!!
No Comments
very hard and boring class
She was nice, really helpful and made the class very interesting.
Extremely helpful, one of the nicest professors on campus.  Be warned that her classes usually involve a lot of reading, but it's worth it!
Phenomenal teacher, but she makes you work hard and constantly keeps you on your toes. But well worth the effort, I left her class with more knowledge.
great instructor ! willing to help student understand the material
enjoyable
Very sociable, workable and makes class interesting.

SEI.Subject: EALL
SEI.Class Name: Women Writers, Culture and Society in East Asia

SEI.Subject: EALL
SEI.Class Name: Women Writers, Culture and Society in East Asia

SEI.Subject: EALL
SEI.Class Name: Women Writers, Culture and Society in East Asia

SEI.Subject: EALL
SEI.Class Name: Women Writers, Culture and Society in East Asia

summary_comment: Dr. Quinn is highly regarded for her passion and dedication to her subject, evident in her thorough lectures and supportive approach to student learning. Students appreciate her fairness and the clear path to achieving high grades with consistent effort. Her classes are discussion-based and involve substantial reading, but many find her engaging and caring, making the workload manageable and the experience rewarding.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Quinn is awesome! She's such a sweetheart. She's clearly passionate about her material and a super fair grader. The only way you could get lower than an A is if you don't show up or skip an assignment. There is a fair amount of reading, but on many days I was able to get it done before class near the end of the semester.

I loved this class way more than I thought I would, which is surprising considering I was really excited for it when I first enrolled. Dr. Quinn is passionate about what she teaches, and it's obvious from the get-go that not only is she knowledgeable, but really loves what she does. She definitely supports her students 100% too.

The class was more discussion based than some of my other classes, but I surprisingly really enjoyed it. There's a good amount of reading (a lit course) but they were enjoyable. She cares for her students and takes the time to listen and know them. Lovely teacher who encourages people to think and share their thoughts and develop ideas further.

Professor Quinn is wonderful and respectful, she cares about her students and definitely shows that all throughout the semester. She truly is a great professor and I hope to have her again before ending my studies at OSU. I definitely recommend her if youre interested in taking JAP2451!

The mean grades of all papers and works she graded are below 88%(except group work). Group discussions and posts for every week, sometimes twice a week. Loads of readings. Also, she changed the form of the final exam into 20 short answers, each contains 3 or 4 sub-questions. It took 8 hours to complete that sheet. Her lecture was extremely boring.

Professor Quinn is one of the best professors I've had here at OSU. She truly has a big heart for her students and makes a genuine effort to get to know each one individually. The material can be a bit heavy at times, but she is always willing to meet after or outside of class if you are struggling. As long as you read everything, you'll get an A!

It's a literature class, so obviously there's a lot of reading. But her lectures are very thorough and she gives you all the information you need for her weekly quizzes. She also provides lots of worksheets and resources for each story you read.

As a professor who teach a literature GE course, she is the teacher that can tell you your thesis in a paper is wrong when there is not really a right or wrong answer. Decent amount of reading material of homework with a nearly impossible detailed mini quiz after the class. Quiz include questions that require a specific page number. Great haha!
Dr. Quinn is a very sweet lady who is very passionate about what she teaches. Her classes are interesting, while also being easy. It was a fun class and I had a great time with Dr. Quinn.

Dr. Quinn is very enthusiastic, and she made me excited to learn about japanese literature. Her discussions were always thought provoking, and although she sometimes leads the discussion into her own direction, she also entertains all students' opinions which are offered. Very fair and easy grader...lots of movies
Great teacher!!!

She likes to fill in your opinions for you and doesn't bother looking outside of the box she's used to. Sure she's passionate but that causes her to be blind to the passionless feelings of the majority of her students.

Really knows her stuff on "Noh" performances.  Very enthusiastic about teaching the subject and provide a nice perspective on what can usually be perceived as a boring art form.  The readings for the class are pretty dull, but the material covered is pretty good.

She is very knowledgeable about what she teaches and is excited about the subjects which makes the lectures more exciting. I've taken 600 and 655 and although sometimes things are confusing she's always fair and very helpful. We also get to watch videos often and have lots of discussion.

She is highly disorganized. She changes assignment frequently with short notice. She expect too much from students. She is very kind and understanding which makes her classes easy but doesn't make up for the fact that they will bore you to death. Avoid avoid avoid.
A very unpleasant woman. Obsessed with her own teaching style which is terrible. No help at all with anything. Read the book as much as possible! Youre definately better off teaching yourself.

Has a love of Japanese literature that rubs off on her students.  Good selection of interesting stories.  Exams and work are fair.  Fun class. Prof Quinn isn't a typical professor type.  She'll talk to you as an equal and is helpful with problems.

SEI.Subject: JAPANSE
SEI.Class Name: Japanese Literature:  Medieval and Edo Periods

SEI.Subject: JAPANSE
SEI.Class Name: Japanese Literature:  Medieval and Edo Periods

SEI.Subject: JAPANSE
SEI.Class Name: Japanese Literature:  Medieval and Edo Periods

summary_comment: Noda Sensei is highly regarded for her dedication and effectiveness as a teacher, though her online courses are challenging due to extensive workload and time management issues. She is strict and expects high fluency and adaptability from her students, which leads to thorough feedback but also harsh grading. Students find her classes demanding but rewarding, emphasizing the importance of hard work and preparation.

Ratings.comment: Noda Sensei is an excellent instructor, but unfortunately I don't think her online course is worth taking. She expects just as much work to get done as an in-person class, and it's difficult to keep up with. She also has tendency to go over class time by 25 minutes, and it's stressful that she clearly never prepares class for the scheduled time

Noda-sensei is somehow a strict person. She expect us to be more fluent and clear in Japanese and be able to react to a different situation without preparation for script. But she is a fair grader and gives good feedback.

Noda-sensei was an excellent teacher, but she expected her students to have a much better understanding of the language than our course-study allowed. She was a harsh grader, but having her made me study harder to avoid failing. Theyre trying to finalize a textbook right now, so all semester our textbook learning material did not match the audio
I really enjoyed this class. Be sure to remember this class is not socializing tea class. You can imagine nutritional science lab course with many kinds of teas. Quiz was very tough too.
She is awesome!
No Comments

SEI.Subject: EALL
SEI.Class Name: Materials Preparation for East Asian Languages

SEI.Subject: EALL
SEI.Class Name: Research Presentations in East Asian Languages and Literatures

SEI.Subject: EALL
SEI.Class Name: Teaching East Asian Languages at the College Level

SEI.Class Name: Level Two Japanese I: Classroom Track

SEI.Class Name: Level Two Japanese II: Classroom Track

SEI.Class Name: Level Two Japanese II: Classroom Track

summary_comment: Professor Huang is an outstanding teacher who genuinely cares about her students' success. She offers additional support when needed, provides ample extra credit opportunities, and ensures her tests are straightforward, provided students adequately prepare. Students consistently praise her teaching quality.

Ratings.comment: I had Professor Huang for Chinese 101 last semester and currently taking 102 with her this semester. She truly cares about her students and is willing to offer extra help if needed! Also give out a lot of extra credits and her tests are pretty straight forward, just make sure to study and you'll pass for sure. Amazing professor!
Very good teacher!!!

summary_comment: The professor is known for their laid-back and enjoyable teaching style, making class time both informative and pleasant with cultural insights and treats like home-baked goods and Japanese snacks. They are highly regarded for their knowledge and ability to articulate complex concepts, often incorporating humor into their lessons. However, some students find the class frustrating due to the professor's impatience and strictness towards tardiness and lack of engagement.

Ratings.comment: In charge of FACT and Writing for the intensive course. Pretty laid-back and easy going. Not a super tough grader and makes class enjoyable. Always has nice cultural information to impart rather than just language info and brought us home baked goods and Japanese snacks sometimes.

Extremely helpful. he knows his stuff and is great at articulating it and working in some witty jokes. The only way he'll be snarky at you is if you're constantly late, and don't take the class seriously. Case in point some kid in my class who nearly missed the exam because he didn't even bother to come to class until someone texted him.
Always shows impatient to students. Feel so frustrated in his class.
